clinical_study.brief_title: Using Simulation to Ensure Basic Competence in Gastroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Using Simulation to Ensure Basic Competence in Gastroscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to develop and gather validity evidence for a simulation-based test to ensure learning basic competence in gastroscopy.

primary_outcome.description: Test score based on time usage, landmark and pathology recognition

secondary_outcome.measure: Total time for the diagnostic exercises
secondary_outcome.description: A total time for two diagnostic virtual reality tests and a test on a phantom

secondary_outcome.measure: Total time for the tool exercises
secondary_outcome.description: A total time of virtual reality tests and two tests on a phantom

secondary_outcome.measure: Total landmark and pathology recognition for the diagnostic exercises
secondary_outcome.description: Recognition of a total number of 48 landmarks and pathologies

arm_group.description: Endoscopy (EGD) assisting nurses. No prior self-performed endoscopies
Medical doctors in medical Gastroenterology or surgery, who have self-performed more than 500 EGD

intervention.description: Simulation-based training with virtual reality simulation at a Simbionix GI-mentor II endoscopy simulator and procedure training on a phantom.

study_pop.textblock: The medical students will be recruited after passing their anatomy exam at the University of Southern Denmark. The endoscopy nurses will be recruited at Odense University Hospital. Medical doctors in medical gastroenterology and surgery will be recruited at the Odense University Hospital, Denmark.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical students enrolled at the University of Southern Denmark who have passed their anatomy exam.
- Experienced endoscopy nurses, who have assisted to more than 100 gastroscopies and with no prior self-performed gastroscopies.
- Experienced medical doctors in medical gastroenterology or surgery, who have self-performed more than 500 gastroscopies.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
